thread.title: ‘StarStruck’ Ultimate Final 14 reveal edge in competition
thread.title_full: ‘StarStruck’ Ultimate Final 14 reveal edge in competition | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Crispina Martinez - Belen
title: ‘StarStruck’ Ultimate Final 14 reveal edge in competition
text:
by Crispina Martinez - Belen
October 9, 2015 Before the Ultimate Final 14 were presented to the entertainment press, the judges of GMA Network’s original reality-based artista search, “StarStruck” – Joey de Leon, Regine Velasquez-Alcasid and Jennylyn Mercado, who was the first ever female Ultimate Survivor – used their fast track privilege and chose four of the hopefuls as finalists: Migo Adecer, Avery Paraiso, Klea Pineda and Ayra Mariano.
Interestingly, when they were asked who they would like to win as Ultimate Survivor many of them chose Migo, Ayra, Klea, Koreen Medina and James Dayrit.
(From left) Migo Adecer, Ayra Mariano, Avery Paraiso, and Klea Pineda
Migo, who was raised in Australia and therefore not so proficient in Tagalog, said his self-confidence was enhanced knowing his fellow candidates were threatened by him. He counts his acting and dancing talents as well as his singing skill as his edge over the rest. He was, in fact, supposed to perform in Kuh Ledesma’s forthcoming concert but begged off because of “StarStruck.”
Ayra believes her edge over the others is her being hard-working. “I know my objective and I will pursue it.” Avery noted his persistence and character are key to his success. Klea, on the other hand, said, “It’s my determination and my hunger to do the best I can.”
James considers himself hardworking and always puts the best effort in what he does. “At may mga undiscovered qualities pa ako,” he added.
The other finalists are: Analyn Barro, Kevin Sagra, Princess Guevarra, Arra San Agustin, Joemarie Nielsen, James Teng, Elyson de Dios, Jay Arcilla, and Liezel Lopez.
“StarStruck” airs weekdays before “24 Oras” on GMA.
• • •
CELEBS AT KANTORI YAKITORI OPENING
Parañaque MayoR Edwin Olivarez, Sampaguita and Azenith Briones with Joe Reyes, Kelly Parreno and Keitaro Chida
Political and showbiz celebrities were special guests during the recent opening of Kantori Yakitori Rest. The guests were led by Parañaque Mayor Edwin Olivarez. Joining him were Sampaguita and Azenith Briones.
Located along Aguirre Ave. in BF Homes Parañaque, Kantori Yakitori is business venture among friends Joe Reyes, Kelly Parreno and Keitaro Chida. There are other Japanese restaurants in BF Homes Paranaque but the owners take pride in the fact that they offer something unique and different. Though their chef isn’t Japanese, Joe said he worked for Asian restaurants abroad for many years, giving him more than enough experience to helm the restaurant.
We were fascinated with the dishes in Kantori Yakitori’s menu so maybe the next time you’re in BF Homes Parañaque, drop by this quaint resto.

Doctors, nurses and health workers are invited to attend…
